love: He kissed me like we were the only true thing in a noisy world.
His mouth was clumsy-sweet. I laughed into it, and then I didn't.
corruption: He took my mouth like a dare; shame flared—and I wanted more.
I tasted sin and didn't spit it out.
hybrid: Rough, then soft—he kissed like both truths could live at once.
We collided, then melted. I think that's our language.
